intro: Athamanta mutellinoides, commonly known as the Cape rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows as a shrub with narrow, leathery leaves and produces small, round fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Athamanta mutellinoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
